alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 7:31PM EST until February 26 at 4:21PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. For the Cumberland River...including Barbourville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Manchester Street and Miller Road east of US 25 E flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage by Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 11 PM.
